security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The skill only uses Read, Grep, and Glob tools to analyze code files. No network calls, no external commands, no file writing, and no credential access. The documentation provides guidance and templates for conducting code reviews.

content.user_title: Review code for security and quality issues
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and often inconsistent. This skill provides automated analysis of code security, performance, maintainability, and test coverage to improve code quality systematically.
actual_capabilities: Analyze code for security vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets)
Identify performance issues (N+1 queries, memory leaks, inefficient algorithms)
Evaluate code maintainability (complexity, duplication, documentation gaps)
Assess test coverage and identify missing test cases
Generate structured review feedback with severity priorities
Provide code examples showing fixes for common issues
limitations: Cannot execute code or run live tests
Cannot access external APIs or services
Cannot modify files or apply fixes automatically
Review quality depends on code context provided

use_cases.title: Pre-commit code analysis
use_cases.description: Review pull requests for security issues before merging to catch vulnerabilities early.

use_cases.title: Code quality standards
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent review criteria across teams with standardized security and performance checklists.

use_cases.title: Contribution review automation
use_cases.description: Automate initial review of contributions to identify issues before human review.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Security Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for security vulnerabilities. Check for SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets, and authentication issues. List findings by severity.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues. Look for N+1 queries, memory leaks, and inefficient algorithms. Suggest specific improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Full Code Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a comprehensive code review covering security, performance, maintainability, and test coverage. Use the standard review format with priority ratings.

prompt_templates.title: Test Gap Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code and identify missing test coverage. Focus on edge cases, error handling, and critical business logic paths.

best_practices: Provide specific file paths and line numbers for all findings
Prioritize issues by severity (critical, high, medium, low)
Include code examples showing both problematic and fixed implementations
Balance criticism with positive feedback for well-written code sections
anti_patterns: Making absolute judgments without explaining the reasoning
Flagging style preferences as security or performance issues
Ignoring the context and constraints under which code was written
Providing vague suggestions without actionable improvement steps

faq.question: Does this skill execute the code it reviews?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads and analyzes code using Read, Grep, and Glob tools. It cannot execute code or make network requests.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with any language that can be read as text. Examples in the documentation use TypeScript, but the review approach applies broadly.

faq.question: Can this skill automatically fix issues?
faq.answer: No. This skill identifies and reports issues with suggestions, but does not modify files or apply fixes automatically.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads code through allowed tools and does not transmit data externally. Code stays local to your environment.

faq.question: Why are my review results different from linters?
faq.answer: This skill provides contextual analysis beyond static linting. It considers business logic, architecture decisions, and edge cases that automated tools may miss.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Copilot or other AI tools?
faq.answer: This skill is specifically designed for code review workflows with structured output formats. It complements other tools by providing human-readable analysis with specific improvement suggestions.
